Class AbstractGrid<T>

java.lang.Object
io.github.ericmedvet.jnb.datastructure.AbstractGrid<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of cell values
All Implemented Interfaces:
Grid<T>, Iterable<Grid.Entry<T>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrayGrid, HashMapGrid
public abstract class AbstractGrid<T> extends Object implements Grid<T>
A partly abstract implementation of Grid. It provides the concrete implementation of a few methods, but does not specify how data is stored. Internally, this implementation stores the keys (coordinates) of the grid.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Method Details

    • checkValidity

      protected void checkValidity(Grid.Key key)
      Checks if the provided coordinate key is valid based on this grid width and height and throws an exception if it is not. Works like Grid.isValid(Key) (which this method internally calls), but the outcome is a possible exception, rather than a Boolean.
      Parameters:
      key - the coordinate to test for validity
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if key is not valid

    • h

      public int h()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Returns the height of the grid, i.e., the smallest non-valid positive y-coordinate. A key is not valid if its y-coordinate is negative or greater or equal to this returned value.
      Specified by:
      h in interface Grid<T>
      Returns:
      the height of the grid

    • w

      public int w()
      Description copied from interface: Grid
      Returns the width of the grid, i.e., the smallest non-valid positive x-coordinate. A key is not valid if its x-coordinate is negative or greater or equal to this returned value.
      Specified by:
      w in interface Grid<T>
      Returns:
      the width of the grid

    • keys

      public List<Grid.Key> keys()
      Description copied from interface: Grid

      Returns a list containing all the valid keys of the grid, ordered first by columns, then by rows. If the grid content is:

      a,b,c
d,e,f

      then the list contains (0,0),(0,1),(1,0),(1,1),(2,0),(2,1).

      Specified by:
      keys in interface Grid<T>
      Returns:
      a list containing the keys of the grid

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a simple string representation of this grid.
      Overrides:

      Returns:
      a simple string representation of this grid
